sense.name: the act of flipping an object into the air
sense.examples: With fifty tosses of a coin, how many are likely to come up heads? The chef's toss of the pizza dough helps him pull it out into a circle. Mary said it takes about ten tosses of the salad to distribute the olive oil evenly. The students celebrated their graduation with a toss of their caps.

sense.name: the intentional determination of a consequence by a random coin toss
sense.commentary: TOSS[+event][+random][+coin_flip][+determination][+of_consequence] Note: a narrow specialization of Sense 1
sense.examples: Our team won the toss so we got to keep the ball. The soldiers had a toss to decide which of them would do reconnaissance on the enemy. The football referee will make the toss.

sense.name: the act of passing a ball to a teammate
sense.examples: The quarterback's toss was intercepted. The toss was fumbled.

sense.name: a sudden anatomical gesture
sense.examples: With a toss of her head, she walked away in anger. The horse swatted at flies with tosses of its tail. He gave a toss of his shoulders to indicate ignorance of the whole matter.
